entry.title: Mel Carnahan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Mel Carnahan (pictured) was the first person to be elected to the United States Senate posthumously?

entry.title: Korean brick toys (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Korean brick toys, colloquially called "Korean Lego", often feature themes of "war and danger", including sets such as military vehicles?

entry.title: Daniela Kerck (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that stage director and scenic designer Daniela Kerck crafted a new ending to Puccini's unfinished opera Turandot for the 2024 Internationale Maifestspiele?

entry.title: Oxtongue River (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Oxtongue River, historically a canoe route for indigenous people, is still used for recreational canoeing?

entry.title: Joely Proudfit (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Native American studies professor Joely Proudfit has received tenure from three different universities?

entry.title: BBL Drizzy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Metro Boomin unknowingly sampled a song created with generative artificial intelligence in the diss track "BBL Drizzy"?

entry.title: Erismatopterus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that young Erismatopterus formed shoals as a likely way to avoid predators?

entry.title: al-Ma'mun al-Bata'ihi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Fatimid vizier al-Ma'mun al-Bata'ihi helped empower Caliph al-Amir, only to be later imprisoned and executed by him?

entry.title: Space Babies (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that due to legal and union restrictions, the production team for the Doctor Who episode "Space Babies" occasionally had to replace real babies with props?
